content.question: If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4250@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is an antiderivative for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAB@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, then <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4441@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals
